Articles.Content:
Long time player new to the forums (been lurking for a while)

I Play as much as I can between work and RL, but not nearly as much as id like!

I Currently play on Enhanced edition (ps4) and I must say that with the new update and history and parts pack I am most impressed! The game generally runs much better, the new parts are great, although I have experienced more lag in the VAB/SPH and Tracking station but this is pretty minor.

I love all things science/sci-fi and spaceflight, especially a good book (hopefully some here know what my user name references?)

Looking forward to being a part of this great community and will be posting some of my creations and taking part in challenges in the near future! (many look really fun!)

Happy launchings everyone!

Hello SecondChance and welcome to the KSP Forum!

We are looking forward to your participation in this 'great community', as you put it.


Happy landings!

Hi @SecondChance! This is indeed a fantastic community!

(By the way, I'm from the UK too so you're not alone in that respect )

17 minutes ago, Starhawk said:

Happy landings!

This make much more sense than happy launchings

@RealKerbal3x Wahey! I imagine there's a few knocking about! I'm looking forward to rocket launches from our home turf in the future (hopefully!)

3 minutes ago, SecondChance said:

@RealKerbal3x Wahey! I imagine there's a few knocking about! I'm looking forward to rocket launches from our home turf in the future (hopefully!)

Indeed...I think the US military want to launch from Scotland, and there's also the company Orbex with their Prime smallsat launcher.

I heard Lockheed martin showed an interest too, I suppose that'd be for the US military though. Also I read on the SpaceX thread that some of the possible inclinations the they could launch into would be useful for Starlink although It'd need to be a bigger complex than planned for that I believe. Would be awesome to see F9 launches happen there (unlikely I think)!
